data.pron_tip: like the i zit, or sit
data.pron_tip_html: like the i z<u>i</u>t, or s<u>i</u>t

data.pron_tip: like the ir in shirt, but the r sound is lighter.
data.pron_tip_html: like the ir in sh<u>ir</u>t, but the r sound is lighter.

data.pron_tip: like ay in bay or pay
data.pron_tip_html: like ay in b<u>ay</u> or p<u>ay</u>

data.pron_tip: like ow in cow or meow, but the a sound is longer.
data.pron_tip_html: like ow in c<u>ow</u> or me<u>ow</u>, but the a sound is longer.

data.pron_tip: like the a in father + the ng in song
data.pron_tip_html: like the a in f<u>a</u>ther + the ng in so<u>ng</u>

data.pron_tip: like the uh in duh, + ng
data.pron_tip_html: like the uh in d<u>uh</u>, + ng

data.pron_tip: like ee in bee, or see
data.pron_tip_html: like ee in b<u>ee</u>, or s<u>ee</u>

data.pron_tip: ee + o sound in so.  This would be easier to remember if it was spelled io.
data.pron_tip_html: ee + o sound in s<u>o</u>.  This would be easier to remember if it was spelled io.

data.pron_tip: like een in preen or teen
data.pron_tip_html: like een in pr<u>een</u> or t<u>een</u>

data.pron_tip: like the english oo in boo, or ooh la la
data.pron_tip_html: like the english oo in b<u>oo</u>, or <u>oo</u>h la la

data.pron_tip: oo + ay in hay or pay.  The i here is pronounced like an 'ei'
data.pron_tip_html: oo + ay in h<u>ay</u> or p<u>ay</u>.  The i here is pronounced like an 'ei'

data.pron_tip: oo + en in taken.  This one is tricky, it is pronounced like 'uen'
data.pron_tip_html: oo + en in tak<u>en</u>.  This one is tricky, it is pronounced like 'uen'

data.pron_tip: no English eqivalent.  To make the sound, start by saying cheeeeeeeeeese, but then round out your lips.
data.pron_tip_html: no English eqivalent.  To make the sound, start by saying cheeeeeeeeeese, but then round out your lips.

data.pron_tip: ü + en in taken.  This is tricky, because it is pronouced like 'üen'
data.pron_tip_html: ü + en in tak<u>en</u>.  This is tricky, because it is pronouced like 'üen'
